Koerner: History and Historiography of Linguistics: Proceedings of the Fourth International Conference on the History of the Language Sciences. John Benjamins Publishing Co. (1990) (p. 521) was an 18th-century French lawyer, grammarian and encyclopédiste. Frank A. Kafker: Notices sur les auteurs des dix-sept volumes de "discours" de l'Encyclopédie. Recherches sur Diderot et sur l'Encyclopédie. 1989, Volume 7, numéro 7, (p. 125–150) == Life == Douchet worked as a lawyer at the Parlement de Paris. Later he taught Latin at the Parisian École royale militaire. As an author he wrote about the general principles of the French language and in 1762 laid the rules of French spelling fixed, including his comments on the debate. In 1765, César Chesneau Dumarsais died, who hitherto contributed on the topic of grammarUniversity of Michigan Library: The Encyclopedia of Diderot & d'Alembert collaborative translation project. for the Encyclopédie by Denis Diderot. After his death, Douchet and Nicolas Beauzée - both teachers at the École Royale Militaire - took over his work.Johann Samuel Ersch: Das gelehrte Frankreich oder Lexicon der französischen Schriftsteller von 1771 bis 1796.
